section.title: Instructions
section.para: First of all, you have to decide which deployment mechanism you want to use. For users of RPM-based Linux distributions (such as Redhat, Fedora Core, and SUSE), we advice to use RPMs, which are available from the release page. For Cygwin users we provide pre-compiled binaries that can simply be unpacked. For Mac OS X users, we provide such a binary package as well, but they can also use the Nix deployment system, which will guarantee that all dependecies are isntalled correctly. Nix packages are also available for Linux users. Finally, it is always possible to buid from source.

Next, download the required packages. Stratego/XT depends on the ATerm Library and the SDF2 Bundle, so you to download aterm, sdf2-bundle, and strategoxt. The downloads are all available at the release page of Stratego/XT.

section.title: Installation of aterm and sdf2-bundle
section.para: The following sequence of commands takes care of building and installing the aterm and the sdf2-bundle in /usr/local.
section.screen:
$ tar zxf aterm-version.tar.gz $ cd aterm-version $ ./configure $ make $ make install $ cd ..
$ tar zxf sdf2-bundle-version.tar.gz $ cd sdf2-bundle-version $ ./configure $ make $ make install $ cd ..

section.title: Installation of Stratego/XT
section.para: Unpack, configure, make and install Stratego/XT using the following commands:
section.screen: $ tar zxf strategoxt-version.tar.gz $ cd strategoxt-version $ ./configure $ make $ make install

As mentioned earler, you can alternatively add the location of the ATerm Library and the SDF2 Bundle to the PKG_CONFIG_PATH, which the configure script will use for searching packages.

section.title: Installation of Stratego Shell, Java Front, etc.
section.para: The Stratego Shell, Java Front, Tiger Base and several other packages depend on Stratego/XT. For all these packages, you can use the following commands:
section.screen: $ tar zxf package-version.tar.gz $ cd package-version $ ./configure $ make $ make install
section.para: For all these packages, you should use the --with-aterm=dir, --with-sdf=dir, and --with-strategoxt=dir options if you installed these packages at non-standard locations. Alternatively, you can extend the PKG_CONFIG_PATH to include the locations of the ATerm Library, SDF2 Bundle, and Stratego/XT.

section.title: Using the Nix Deployment System (*)
section.para: Using the Nix deployment system for the installation of Stratego/XT is a good idea if you need to run multiple versions of Stratego/XT on the same system, if you will need to update other Stratego/XT related packages regularly, or if there is a problem with installation from source at your system. The Nix deployment system is designed to guarantee that the Stratego/XT that we are using on our system is exatly reproduced on your system. This basically guarantees that the installation will never fail because of missing dependencies or mistakes in the configuration.
